intro: Mosannona guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan mosannona, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashews and mangoes. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces a fruit that is typically orange or red in color, containing a single seed. Mosannona guatemalensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
